page.title: 16RIVER EVENLODE AT CHARLBURY
page.content: The river that runs through Charlbury is called the River Evenlode.It's source is near Moreton in Marsh.It runs beside Walcot Farm and there is a weir there. In Charlbury the bridge that crosses the River on Dyers Hill has been there since the Middle Ages. There are two bridges, including Jubilee Bridge, which cross the river and the river also runs through the Evenlode valley.The big house by the river used to be a toll house.There is a canoeing club which takes place on a Sunday afternoon.Quite a few people fish in the river and many children like to paddle and swim there.The river also runs by the Railway and is very windy.It flows into the River Thames near Eynsham.The Evenlode Valley gets it's name from the river running through it.
